oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Wrigley's Thanksgiving Show - 1948-11-25 - Part 5
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Wrigley's 1948 Thanksgiving special, originally broadcast 1948-11-25 (part 5). Featuring Gene Autry (host, performer), Arthur Godfrey (host, performer), Lud Gluskin (conductor), Lou Crosby (announcer), Les Weinrott (producer), with performers the Andrews Sisters, Pat Buttram, members of the cast of My Friend Irma (Marie Wilson as Irma, Joan Banks as Jane, creator Cy Howard), Carmen Miranda, Abe Burrows, Dorothy Lamour, Amos 'n' Andy (Freeman Gosden and Charles Correll), Danny Kaye, Roddy McDowall, Abbott and Costello, Buddy Clark, Louella Parsons, Phil Gordon, and the Pinafores.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Gene Autry; Pinafores; Danny Kaye
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Network announcement -- Station announcement -- Arthur Godfrey and Gene Autry talk -- Gene Autry introduces the Pinafores -- You Call Everybody Darlin' (Gene Autry, Pinafores) -- Gene Autry introduces Danny Kaye -- Comedy routine (Danny Kaye, Arthur Godfrey) -- Stanislavsky (Danny Kaye)
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: CBS Inc.; Autry, Gene, 1907-1998; Godfrey, Arthur, 1903-1983; Gluskin, Lud; Crosby, Lou; Weinrott, Les; Andrews Sisters; Buttram, Pat; My friend Irma (Radio program); Wilson, Marie, 1916-1972; Banks, Joan, 1918-; Howard, Cy; Miranda, Carmen, 1909-1955; Burrows, Abe, 1910-1985; Lamour, Dorothy, 1914-1996; Gosden, Freeman F., 1899-1982; Correll, Charles J., 1890-1972; Kaye, Danny; McDowall, Roddy; Abbott and Costello (Comedy team); Clark, Buddy, 1911-1949; Parsons, Louella O. (Louella Oettinger), 1881-1972; Gordon, Phil, 1916-2010; Pinafores (Musical group); KOMA (Radio station : Oklahoma City, Okla.); KHBC (Radio station : Hilo, Hawaii); KGMD (Radio station : Honolulu, Hawaii); WTOP (Radio station : Washington, D.C.)
